block.p: The director of New Jersey's Casino Reinvestment Development Authority, Curtis Bashaw, submitted his resignation last Tuesday. Mr. Bashaw, appointed to the $137,500-a-year job last year by former Gov. James E. McGreevey, said he was returning to his business as a real estate developer in Cape May, where he has restored several hotels, including Congress Hall. The authority, in addition to overseeing the redevelopment of Atlantic City, distributes revenue from casino taxes to economic development projects around the state. Mr. Bashaw's resignation is effective Sept. 30. Laura Mansnerus

The director of New Jersey's Casino Reinvestment Development Authority, Curtis Bashaw, submitted his resignation last Tuesday. Mr. Bashaw, appointed to the $137,500-a-year job last year by former Gov. James E. McGreevey, said he was returning to his business as a real estate developer in Cape May, where he has restored several hotels, including Congress Hall. The authority, in addition to overseeing the redevelopment of Atlantic City, distributes revenue from casino taxes to economic development projects around the state. Mr. Bashaw's resignation is effective Sept. 30. Laura Mansnerus
